com.github.triceo.splitlog.api

Interface LogWatch

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MessageProducer<LogWatch>

    public interface LogWatch
extends MessageProducer<LogWatch>
    The primary point of interaction with this tool. Allows users to start listening to changes in log files.

      • startFollowing

        Follower startFollowing()
        Begin watching for new messages from this point in time.
        Returns:
        API for watching for messages.

      • startFollowing

        @Deprecated
org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Follower,Message> startFollowing(MidDeliveryMessageCondition<LogWatch> waitFor)
        Deprecated. 
        Begin watching for new messages from this point in time, immediately calling Follower#waitFor(MidDeliveryMessageCondition) - this way, no messages can be missed between the actual start of the tailer and the first wait. . In version 1.7.0, this function will change the return value to that of startFollowingWithExpectation(MidDeliveryMessageCondition).
        Parameters:
        waitFor - Condition to pass to the follower.
        Returns:
        The new follower and the result of the wait call.

      • startFollowing

        @Deprecated
org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Follower,Message> startFollowing(MidDeliveryMessageCondition<LogWatch> waitFor,
                                                                              long howLong,
                                                                              TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Begin watching for new messages from this point in time, immediately calling Follower#waitFor(MidDeliveryMessageCondition, long, TimeUnit) - this way, no messages can be missed between the actual start of the tailer and the first wait. In version 1.7.0, this function will disappear entirely. startFollowingWithExpectation(MidDeliveryMessageCondition) will provide all the functionality of this method.
        Parameters:
        waitFor - Condition to pass to the follower.
        howLong - How long to wait for the condition to be met.
        unit - The time unit for the above.
        Returns:
        The new follower and the result of the wait call.

      • startFollowingWithExpectation

        @Deprecated
org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<Follower,Future<Message>> startFollowingWithExpectation(MidDeliveryMessageCondition<LogWatch> waitFor)
        Deprecated. 
        Begin watching for new messages from this point in time, immediately calling Follower#expect(MidDeliveryMessageCondition) - this way, no messages can be missed between the actual start of the tailer and the first wait. In 1.7.0 version, this function will be renamed to startFollowing(MidDeliveryMessageCondition).
        Parameters:
        waitFor - Condition to pass to the follower.
        Returns:
        The new follower and the expectation.

      • startHandingDown

        boolean startHandingDown(MessageMeasure<? extends Number,Follower> measure,
                       String id)
        Every new Follower from now on will immediately receive a new MessageMetric instance with a given ID that is using the given measure instance.
        Parameters:
        measure - Measure to use in the newly created MessageMetric instance.
        id - The ID to locate the MessageMetric using MessageProducer.getMetric(String). No relation to the ID used by MessageProducer.startMeasuring(MessageMeasure, String).
        Returns:
        False if either the measure or the ID is already being handed down.

      • stopFollowing

        boolean stopFollowing(Follower follower)
        Stop particular follower from following.
        Parameters:
        follower - This follower will receive no more messages.
        Returns:
        True if terminated as a result, false if already terminated.

      • stopHandingDown

        boolean stopHandingDown(MessageMeasure<? extends Number,Follower> measure)
        Invalidate startHandingDown(MessageMeasure, String). No further Follower will automatically receive MessageMetric using this measure by default.
        Parameters:
        measure - The measure to no longer be handing down to newly instantiated Followers.
        Returns:
        False if it wasn't being handed down.

      • stopHandingDown

        boolean stopHandingDown(String id)
        Invalidate startHandingDown(MessageMeasure, String). No further Follower will automatically receive MessageMetric using this measure by default.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the MessageMeasure to no longer be handing down to newly instantiated Followers. No relation to the ID used by MessageProducer.startMeasuring(MessageMeasure, String) .
        Returns:
        False if it wasn't being handed down.

      • terminate

        boolean terminate()
        Stop all followers from following and free resources. Will terminate every running measurement via MessageMetric.
        Returns:
        True if terminated as a result, false if already terminated.
